record.title: ORDERS FOR TUESDAY, OCTOBER 23, 2007
record.narrative:
ORDERS FOR TUESDAY, OCTOBER 23, 2007 -- (Senate - October 22, 2007)

[Page: S13203]

speaking.paragraph: Madam President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 10 a.m., Tuesday, October 23; that on Tuesday, following the prayer and the pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed to have expired, the time for the two leaders be reserved for use later in the day, and the Senate resume consideration of H.R. 3043, as provided for under the previous order; that on Tuesday the Senate recess from 12:30 to 2:15 p.m. for the respective party conferences.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
